newsitem.title: USA: Lark sees lower Q1 net.
newsitem.headline: Lark sees lower Q1 net.

text.p: Lark Technologies Inc said on Friday that it expects to report net income for the first quarter ended March 31 in the range of $125,000 to $140,000, or $0.04 per share.
The company's first quarter net income for 1996 was $220,288, it said.

The company also projected that its revenues for the first quarter would approach $1.1 million, an increase of about 25 percent compared with the third and fourth quarters of 1996 but down from $1,200,000 in last year's first quarter.

Lark noted in a statement that the revenues for the first quarter of 1996 included significant revenues from a DNA sequencing project. "This project accounted for 66 percent of the revenues for this first quarter of 1996," the company said.
The company said revenues for the second quarter should be similar to the first quarter's, in part because of continued customer diversification.
Lark Technologies provides contract DNA sequencing and related molecular biology services to commercial, government and academic institutions.
